events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at the intersection, resulting in significant front-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the car collision and associated damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case and communicate with the customer regarding next steps and required documents.
The customer received acknowledgement of the claim filing and was informed about the investigation process and expected timelines.
The insurance company requested copies of the police report, vehicle registration, and photographic evidence of the damage sustained.
Customer submitted all requested documentation including the police report, photos, and repair estimates from the mechanic.
A claims investigator began reviewing submitted materials and scheduled an inspection of the damaged vehicle for further assessment.
The investigation was completed confirming the extent of the collision damage and no evidence of policy violation found.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer detailing coverage amounts, repair costs, and deductible payments required.
The customer responded with questions regarding the proposed settlement and requested clarification on certain repair cost items.
After review, the claim was approved with the agreed settlement amount covering all verified damages minus the deductible.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account as per the approved settlement to cover repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that repairs were underway.
All case documents and communications were archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
